alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:41PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rich... northeastern Wasatch...northwestern Duchesne...east central Morgan... western Summit and southwestern Uinta Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 240 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Coalville to 9 miles northeast of Oakley to 13 miles south of Mirror Lake. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Evanston, Coalville, Mirror Lake, Wahsatch, Emory, Hoytsville, Castle Rock, Trial Lk, Almy and Echo Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 158 and 166, and between mile markers 168 and 196. Utah Route 35 near mile marker 17, and between mile markers 19 and 28. Mirror Lake Highway between mile markers 12 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
